key_points: Germany has achieved a record share of 62.7% in renewable energy generation in 2024.
The country has successfully phased out nuclear power and is a leader in offshore wind and solar energy.
Significant legislative reforms have been implemented to support renewable energy planning.
Increasing share of renewable energy in Japan's electricity mix
Focus on offshore wind power and decarbonization efforts
Potential challenges highlighted by industry withdrawals, indicating need for reform
